standard_metadata.standard_description: Use decimal notation for fractions with denominators 10 or 100.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Write decimals and fractions shown on number lines

question.content: Look at the number line below.    **Identify the point on the number line and write it as both a fraction and a decimal.**  **Fraction:**         **Decimal:**

images.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting mark at 0, nine unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 1. There is a dot at the seventh tick mark to the right of 0.

hints.content: The number line between $0$ and $1$ is split into $10$ equal pieces.    Each piece has a length of $\dfrac{1}{10}$ .    [[☃ image 4]]

images.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting mark at 0, nine unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 1. There is a dot at the seventh tick mark to the right of 0 with a question mark below it. Above the number line from 0 to 1 is a tape diagram split into ten equal parts each labeled one tenth.

hints.content: Starting at $0$, we move $\blueE{{7} \text{ lengths of } \dfrac{1}{10}}$ to get to the point at $\blueE{\dfrac{7}{10}}$ .  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: The same number line as above showing seven pieces of the tape diagram shaded and an arrow moving from left to right starting with 0 and ending at 0.7.

hints.content: $\blueE{\dfrac{7}{10}}$ can also be expressed as $\blueE{7 \text{ tenths}}$.
Let's use a place value chart to write $\blueE{7 \text{ tenths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | ${7}$ |
We can write the point on the number line in the following ways:  * Fraction:  $\dfrac{7}{10}$  * Decimal: $0.7$

question.content: Look at the number line below.    **Identify the point on the number line and write it as both a fraction and a decimal.**  **Fraction:**         **Decimal:**

images.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting mark at 0, nine unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled one-tenth, nine unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled two-tenths, nine unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at three-tenths. There is a dot at the seventh tick mark to the right of 0.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\tealE{\dfrac{1}{10}}$, or $\tealE{1 \text{ tenth}}$.  Let's zoom in.  There are $10$ equal distances between each $\tealE{\dfrac{1}{10}}$ on the number line. Those distances are each $\redE{\dfrac{1}{100}}$, or $\redE{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero to one-tenth with tick marks at every one-hundredth unit. Above the number line is a portion of a fraction bar showing 10 equal sections each labeled one-hundredth.

hints.content: The point is $\redE{ \text{7 hundredths}}$ after $\purpleD{0}$.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero to ten-hundredths with tick marks at every one-hundredth unit. An arrow points right from a point at zero to a point at seven-hundredths. Above the number line is a portion of a fraction bar showing 10 equal sections each labeled one-hundredth. The first 7 sections are shaded.

hints.content: $\blueE{\dfrac{7}{100}}$ can also be expressed as $\blueE{7 \text{ hundredths}}$.
Let's use a place value chart to write $\blueE{7 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.    Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | ${0}$ | ${7}$
We can express the location of the point on the number line in the following ways:  * Fraction:  $\dfrac{7}{100}$  * Decimal: $0.07$

images.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting mark at 0, nine unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled one-tenth, nine unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled two-tenths, nine unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at three-tenths. There is a dot at the seventh tick mark to the right of one-tenth.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\tealE{\dfrac{1}{10}}$, or $\tealE{1 \text{ tenth}}$.  Let's zoom in.  There are $10$ equal distances between each $\tealE{\dfrac{1}{10}}$ on the number line. Those distances are each $\redE{\dfrac{1}{100}}$, or $\redE{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled one-tenth to two-tenths with tick marks at every one-hundredth unit. Above the number line is a portion of a fraction bar showing 10 equal sections each labeled one-hundredth.

hints.content: The point is $\redE{ \text{7 hundredths}}$ after $\purpleD{\dfrac{1}{10}}$.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A number line labeled ten-hundredths to twenty-hundredths with tick marks at every one-hundredth unit. An arrow points right from a point at ten-hundredths to a point at seventeen-hundredths. Above the number line is a portion of a fraction bar showing 10 equal sections each labeled one-hundredth. The first 7 sections are shaded.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\dfrac{1}{10}}$ and $\redE{7\text{ hundredths}}$ is $\blueE{0.17}$.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |${0}$|${.}$  | $\purpleD{1}$ | $\redE{7}$  We can read the number as $\blueE{17\text{ hundredths}}$.  We can write the fraction as $\blueE{\dfrac{17}{100}}$.
We can express the location of the point on the number line in the following ways:  * Fraction:  $\dfrac{17}{100}$  * Decimal: $0.17$

question.content: Look at the number line below.    **Identify the point on the number line and write it as both a fraction and a decimal.**  **Fraction:**         **Decimal:**

images.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting mark at seven-tenths, nine unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled eight-tenths, nine unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled nine-tenths, nine unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at one whole. There is a dot one tick mark to the right of seven tenths.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\tealE{0.1}$, or $\tealE{1 \text{ tenth}}$.  Let's zoom in.  There are $10$ equal distances between each $\tealE{0.1}$ on the number line. Those distances are each $\redE{0.01}$, or $\redE{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A number line labeled seven-tenths to eight-tenths with tick marks at every one-hundredth unit. Above the number line is a portion of a fraction bar showing 10 equal sections each labeled 0.01.

hints.content: The point is $\redE{ \text{1 hundredth}}$ after $\purpleD{0.7}$.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A number line labeled seven-tenths to eight-tenths with tick marks at every one-hundredth unit. An arrow points right from a point at 0.70 to a point at 0.71. Above the number line is a portion of a fraction bar showing 10 equal sections each labeled 0.01. The first section is shaded.

hints.content: $\purpleD{0.7}$ and $\redE{1\text{ hundredth}}$ is $\blueE{0.71}$.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\purpleD{0}$|$\purpleD{.}$  | $\purpleD{7}$ | $\redE{1}$  We can read the number as $\blueE{71\text{ hundredths}}$.  We can write the fraction as $\blueE{\dfrac{71}{100}}$.
We can express the location of the point on the number line in the following ways:  * Fraction:  $\dfrac{71}{100}$  * Decimal: $0.71$
